topic.question: 1. Most people like California's climate. What do they like?
2. Joe wanted something to cover his head. What did he want?
3. What did you think of the music?
option: It was cooked just long enough.
It was just the right size.
It had a very pleasing melody.

topic.question: 4. Thad's feeling pretty good. How does he feel?
5. Edmund made a mistake.
6. Mr. Miller knows what the population of New York is.
option: He knows where New York is.
He knows how to get to New York.
He knows how many miles away New York is.
He knows how many people live in New York.

topic.question: 7. Our enemies are invisible.
option: They are bigger than we are.
They are horrible to look at.

topic.question: 8. The little girl had a problem when she tried to tie her shoes.
option: It was easy for her to tie her shoes.
It was difficult for her to tie her shoes.
She liked to tie her shoes.

topic.question: 9. You can store food in a refrigerator.
option: Food may be bought in a store.
Food may be kept in a refrigerator.
You can buy it at the food store.

topic.question: 10. Jane selected a book.
11. How many hands do you have?
12. If the men need aid, they should go to Sgt. Carson. When should the men go to Sgt. Carson?
13. How were you able to cross the Atlantic Ocean in such a short time?
14. Tom arrived at the airport at 6. The plane took off at 7. When did Tom arrive at the airport?
option: too late to see the plane take off
seven hours before the plane took off
an hour before the plane took off

topic.question: 15. Do you always drive so fast?
option: No, I have never driven slowly.
No, only when I am in a hurry.
Yes, I would like to drive very much.
Yes, or we will be late.

topic.question: 16. Pilots must read their instruments accurately. How must they read them?
17. Defense was their main concern. What was their main concern?
18. The student said, "I want to cash a check." What did he want to do?
option: put the money in the bank

topic.question: 19. Joe's friend said, "I have an extra room."
option: Joe's friend has a spare room.
Joe's friend has a large room.
Joe's friend has only once room.

topic.question: 20. We eat a variety of vegetables every day.
option: We eat different kinds of vegetables daily.
We always eat the same vegetables.
We eat a vegetable with out meat every day.
We only eat one vegetable every day.

topic.question: 21. Carol said, "Let's go in. I am freezing " Laura said, "I am too. Let's go
22. Trudy must concentrate on her lessons or she will fail.
option: She must go to class until next fall.
She must not study too much.
She must pay close attention to her lessons.

topic.question: 23. We must hurry with this job.
option: We must work a very long time.

topic.question: 24. After the storm, the electricity was shut off for about an hour.
option: It kept flowing for an hour.

topic.question: 25. The cat must stay out.

26. Why did some women wear perfume?
It ______ good.

27. Ralph owes a bank a lot of money.
Ralph is in ______.
28. Jerry recognized his old friend at the concert.
29. John said, "Bill might go to town." What did John say?
option: Bill is definitely going to town.

topic.question: 30. The clock is attached to the wall. Where is the clock?
31. The football player was hurt on impact. How did he get hurt?
32. As Mr. Carson was driving his car, he heard a noise in the back of the car. He stopped to see what it was. When did he hear a noise?
option: in the back of the car

topic.question: 33. The accident was caused by the pilot's blurred vision. What caused the accident?
34. The tail of the plane was damaged. What part of the plane was damaged?
35. All systems in an automobile are designed to do a specific job.
option: Each system is the specific job of an engineer.
Each system is planned to do a particular job.
Each system must have several functions.
Designing the system is a particular job.

topic.question: 36. The weather report indicated no precipitation for today.
option: There will be no clouds today.

topic.question: 37. The soldiers rescued the trapped lieutenant.
38. Emily's first impression of the city was good.
option: Her first question about the city was answered.
Her first thoughts of the city were favorable
Her first trip to the city wasn't that nice.
Her first duty in the city was fine.

topic.question: 39. Except for Charles, everyone was present.
option: Everyone was present because of Charles.
Everyone was present according to Charles.

topic.question: 40. Two lesser-known petroleum products are plastic and insecticides.
41. Joe dropped out of Judo class.
42. If she sat next to me on the bus, where did she sit?
43. Which is a fluid?
44. My grandmother needs to take a snooze.

45. There is a shortage of food.
There's ______ food.
46. The car lost the right front tire. What did the car lose?
option: a bolt from the right wheel

topic.question: 47. What is lead?
48. Ted said he would have a bit more. How much did he want?
49. Why did the welder use goggles?
50. The work didn't require much effort.
51. Warm air is less dense than cold air.

52. That plane is tremendous.
It is ______.
53. Yesterday the wind came from the south and it was warm. Today it is from the north and it is cold. Why is it cold today?
54. We regret that you had the accident.

55. Belinda can't stand her supervisor.
She can't ______ him.

57. M: What is the price of a bus ticket to Houston?
W: Nineteen-fifty.
Q: What did the woman say?
option: The cost is nineteen dollars and fifty cents.
The bus will arrive in Houston at 1950.

topic.question:
58. W: Are you ready?
M: I can't wait to try those potatoes.
Q: What are the man and the woman ready to do?

59. W: How can we carry the packages from a car?
M: We can separate the heavy ones from the light ones.
Q: What did the man say?
option: There are too many packages to carry.
They could put the packages in two groups.
They would leave some packages in the car.

topic.question:
60. W: Why can't you let me in?
M: I forgot the key.
Q: Why can't the man and the woman go in?

61. M: What is the prime reason for coming here?
W: I don't know the prime reason.
Q: What is it that the woman didn't know?

62. W: Did you move the books?
M: Yes, I thought they would fall.
Q: What did the man think the books would do?

63. W: What are your duties, Lt. Parks?
M: My field is telegraphy.
Q: What does Lt. Parks do?
option: He observes and directs artillery fire.
He builds military roads and bridges.
He sends coded messages over wire.
He guides planes in the right direction.

topic.question:
64. W: I need a used car.
M: I can show you this one for only fifteen hundred dollars.
W: May I try it out?
Q: What does the woman want to do?
option: She wants to drive the car.
She wants to look at the car.
She wants to buy the car.
She wants to talk about the car.

topic.question:
65. W: Where should we meet tomorrow? I think the corner will be goc
M: I was going to say the post office. But now I think we'd better r
Q: Where will the man and the woman probably meet?

66. W: He collects rocks from all parts of the world.
M: That's nice. But do they have any value?
Q: What does the man want to know?
